intro: Rhinanthus crista-galli subsp. stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved common tickseed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to other subspecies of Rhinanthus crista-galli. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. This plant is also known for its hemiparasitic nature, relying on host plants for some of its nutritional needs.
